The internet community is to be admired for its ability to not only to complain about things thoroughly but actually spring into action and provide a solution to the problem. This was perfectly demonstrated with the release of iTunes 10, its terrible icon and the slew of replacement options created in the days following.

Unfortunately I’ve never seen a more uninspired group of alternatives. Every one of them is at most a slight variation, keeping or even exacerbating the worst parts of the original.
